comments.text:
The 360 Video isn't working for me on OS X (both current Nightly and 8.0). The music plays, but the video area is just black. I get the following errors in my Error Console (in Firefox 8):


Error: syntax error
Source File: https://developer.mozilla.org/media/uploads/demos/p/a/paulrouget/7268b372ce0304262b846a4f773e900f/360-video_1304582018_demo_package/wglu_texture.vert
Line: 1, Column: 1
Source Code:
attribute vec3 vertex;

Error: syntax error
Source File: https://developer.mozilla.org/media/uploads/demos/p/a/paulrouget/7268b372ce0304262b846a4f773e900f/360-video_1304582018_demo_package/texture.frag
Line: 1, Column: 1
Source Code:
#ifdef GL_ES


This makes me sad because I wanted to use this demo as an example to a "Now let's see you do that in HTML5." comment on http://www.reddit.com/r/videos/comments/metna/click_drag_be_amazed/ :-(

comments.raw_text:
Adding Christian--

Not sure who is maintaining this code, but would be good to have someone making sure our demos are working with the latest versions of Firefox as this is also true for several of our other web o wonder demos.

Adding Paul and Jay so they can share where all the code is.

comments.raw_text:
Hmm, I think it wasn't just CORS. Seems both the video and audio is in a single webm file, so if I'm hearing the audio I'd expect the the video to be available.

Possibly a bug in how the <video> is mapped to the <canvas> on screen?
comments.author: jdinbox@gmail.com
comments.text:
